column4: Hi. I'm running Kubuntu Edgy, and my SD card read (USB) runs great, apps auto-mount it and everything, except that it's read only, despite me having full permissions. Any ideas?
Pong
:P
hrm.. let me try an SD in my laptop
thanks. It's odd, because really, it works great. Just can't write/delete/etc
Malexander: it's a busy channel. Usually if someone doesn't know the answer, they just don't say anything. prevents traffic
I just put my SD card from my cell phone into my Thinkpad's internal SD slot
and was able to write no issue
Well, then, give my your laptop, Mr. "Works for me!"
haha
just to verify, the photo I copied to the SD card shows up when I put it back in my phone
Joking aside, any ideas, maybe? I don't know crap about USB device handling or whatnot, let alone about this in particular
best thing you can do is open a terminal and look at the output of dmesg
or if you don't know what to look for, do this from a terminal
dmesg > ColonelPanic001.txt
Just did that, getting a filesystem panic. Mind if I PM a few lines to you?
and mail it to superq@gmail.com
Or that. heh
pastebin'ing it. Soon as this site actually does something...
oh.. hehe
i forget about pastebin
